headline: Micron Exits Crucial Consumer Memory Business to Focus on High-Growth AI Data Center Chips Amid Supply Shortage
summary: Micron Technology Inc. (NASDAQ:MU) is one of the most profitable tech stocks to buy. On December 3, Micron Technology announced that it will exit its consumer memory business, including the sale of products under its Crucial brand. This is being done to double down on advanced memory chips used in AI data centers, which is […]

headline: This Week In AI Chips - Synopsys Faces Legal Challenges Amid Revenue and Income Decline
summary: Synopsys, Inc., a provider of design automation software for integrated circuits, has recently faced legal challenges following a significant stock decline. The company’s Design IP segment, which includes AI-driven silicon components, reported a 7.7% year-over-year decline in revenue and a 43% drop in net income for the third quarter of 2025. This downturn is attributed to increased customization demands from customers, impacting profitability and prompting considerations for a change in...

headline: Stocks Set to Open Higher as Investors Await Fed Meeting
summary: December S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESZ25) are up +0.12%, and December Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQZ25) are up +0.23% this morning, pointing to a higher open on Wall Street as investors look ahead to the Federal Reserve’s final monetary policy committee meeting of the year, where another rate cut is widely expected.

headline: Stocks to Watch Monday: IBM, Boeing, Broadcom, CoreWeave

headline: A Key Moment for AI Stocks Comes This Week—and It Has Nothing to Do With Nvidia
summary: The artificial-intelligence trade that has fueled the market’s rally can swing in either direction this week, with earnings from  Oracle  being the pivotal event.  The market’s focus on AI growth has widened from just looking at Nvidia’s chip demand.  Wall Street is rightly concerned about how sustainable the growth in data center demand is, and investors are becoming increasingly vigilant of demand signals from a host of key companies.

content.title: A Key Moment for AI Stocks Comes This Week—and It Has Nothing to Do With Nvidia
content.summary: The artificial-intelligence trade that has fueled the market’s rally can swing in either direction this week, with earnings from  Oracle  being the pivotal event.  The market’s focus on AI growth has widened from just looking at Nvidia’s chip demand.  Wall Street is rightly concerned about how sustainable the growth in data center demand is, and investors are becoming increasingly vigilant of demand signals from a host of key companies.

headline: Dow Falls as Investors Count Down to Fed Meeting
summary: Stocks drifted lower as the battle for Warner Bros. Discovery went hostile and investors expected a Fed rate cut this week. The Dow and S&P 500 both fell 0.4%, with technology the only sector posting a gain.
